Beyond Imagination
Beep & Go! Guiding the Way.
Ready, Set, Learn!
You Need to Know
• Basic understanding of how to connect a simple circuit with a battery, wires, and a switch.
• Basic components of a circuit (e.g., buzzers, push buttons). • How to count numbers, especially within a range like 1 to 20.
• How a push button works (pressing it to complete a circuit). You will be able to:
• Explain how sound can be used to help visually impaired people navigate safely. • Design a simple sound-guided path using buzzers and push buttons. • Use addition and subtraction to calculate distances between buzzers on the sound-guided path.
• Describe how community helpers, such as city planners and engineers, use sound to assist people with visual impairments.
49

Ms. Sara: “Imagine you're at the playground, but you can't see where to go. How can we help children who can’t see move around safely?”
Adam: “Maybe we can use sounds to guide them!”
Laila: “Like a special beep that tells them where to go!”
Khaled: “What if they press a button, and it makes a sound to show them the way?”
Ms. Sara: “That’s a great idea! What can we use to make a sound when someone pushes the button?”
Adam: “A buzzer! It makes a loud beep!”
Laila: “We can make a path with buttons and buzzers so they can follow the sounds!”
Ms. Sara: “Great thinking! Let’s design a smart playground with sound-guided paths!”

Think!
How do community helpers use sounds to help people who can't see?
Check all that apply: Buzzers on sidewalks tell us where to go.
Flashing lights tell us where to go.
Traffic lights make sounds to say when to stop or go. Smartphones can talk to us and guide our way.
Beacons in buildings help us find rooms and exits. Talking walls give directions.

DIY Lab
Hello, young engineers! Let’s explore how sound can help someone walk safely along a path.
What to do:
• We’ll gently cover your eyes with a soft cloth. • Start at the beginning of the path.
• Your partner will press a button to make a sound. • Listen closely… then walk toward the sound!
Let’s Talk About It: 1 . How did the sound help you?
It showed me where to go. It made me feel confused.
It helped me find the next button. It didn’t help me at all.
51

2 . What if there were no sounds?
I wouldn’t know which way to go.
I could still find the path easily. I might get lost.
I might walk the wrong way.
